org.jtrim.concurrent

Class MultiPhaseTask<ResultType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.concurrent.MultiPhaseTask<ResultType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ResultType - the type of the result of this task. The result can be specified to the finishTask method and later can also be retrieved by the shared future's get methods.

    public final class MultiPhaseTask<ResultType>
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a task which is made of multiple subtasks. Once the task is finished anyone may call finishTask to finish this MultiPhaseTask. The main advantages of this class is that it offers a future object representing the MultiPhaseTask and it can notify a listener when the MultiPhaseTask terminates and no more subtasks may run anymore.

    Therefore to use this class, submit subtasks by one of the executeSubTask or submitSubTask methods and when finished invoke the finishTask method (possibly from a subtask).

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static interface  MultiPhaseTask.TerminateListener<ResultType>
      The listener interface which can be notified when a specific MultiPhaseTask terminates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiPhaseTask

        public MultiPhaseTask(MultiPhaseTask.TerminateListener<? super ResultType> terminateListener)
        Creates a new non-terminated MultiPhaseTask with the given terminate listener.
        Parameters:
        terminateListener - the listener to be notified when this task terminates. This argument can be null, if no such notification is required.

    • Method Detail

      • getFuture

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<ResultType> getFuture()
        Returns the Future representing this task. The returned future provides all the features of the Future interface. That is:
        • The get methods can be used to wait for this task to terminate and retrieve its result.
        • Canceling the returned future will cancel this task with no exception if it did not terminate for some other reason.
        • The canceled and the done state of this task can also be queried.
        Returns:
        the Future representing this task. This method never returns null.

      • executeSubTask

        public void executeSubTask(UpdateTaskExecutor executor,
                  java.lang.Runnable task)
        Submits the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask to the given UpdateTaskExecutor. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the submitted subtask throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Parameters:
        executor - the UpdateTaskExecutor to which the specified task will be submitted to. This argument cannot be null.
        task - the task to be executed on the specified UpdateTaskExecutor. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if either executor or task is null

      • executeSubTask

        public void executeSubTask(TaskExecutor executor,
                  CancellationToken cancelToken,
                  CancelableTask task,
                  CleanupTask cleanupTask)
        Submits the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask to the given TaskExecutor. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the submitted subtask throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutor to which the specified task will be submitted to. This argument cannot be null.
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which is to be checked if the submitted task is to be canceled. This is the CancellationToken which will be forwarded to the specified TaskExecutor. This argument cannot be null.
        task - the task to be executed on the specified TaskExecutor. This argument cannot be null.
        cleanupTask - the cleanup task to be executed after the specified task completes or it is determined that it will never be executed. This argument can be null if no such task is required. Note that the cleanup task will always be executed by the specified TaskExecutor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if either executor, cancelToken or task is null

      • submitSubTask

        public TaskFuture<?> submitSubTask(TaskExecutorService executor,
                          CancellationToken cancelToken,
                          CancelableTask task,
                          CleanupTask cleanupTask)
        Submits the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask to the given TaskExecutorService. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the submitted subtask throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutorService to which the specified task will be submitted to. This argument cannot be null.
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which is to be checked if the submitted task is to be canceled. This is the CancellationToken which will be forwarded to the specified TaskExecutorService. This argument cannot be null.
        task - the task to be executed on the specified TaskExecutorService. This argument cannot be null.
        cleanupTask - the cleanup task to be executed after the specified task completes or it is determined that it will never be executed. This argument can be null if no such task is required. Note that the cleanup task will always be executed by the specified TaskExecutorService.
        Returns:
        the future representing the submitted subtask. This method never returns null assuming that the specified TaskExecutorService never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if either executor, cancelToken or task is null

      • submitSubTask

        public <V> TaskFuture<V> submitSubTask(TaskExecutorService executor,
                              CancellationToken cancelToken,
                              CancelableFunction<V> task,
                              CleanupTask cleanupTask)
        Submits the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask to the given TaskExecutorService. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the submitted subtask throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the result of the submitted subtask
        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutorService to which the specified task will be submitted to. This argument cannot be null.
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which is to be checked if the submitted task is to be canceled. This is the CancellationToken which will be forwarded to the specified TaskExecutorService. This argument cannot be null.
        task - the task to be executed on the specified TaskExecutorService. This argument cannot be null.
        cleanupTask - the cleanup task to be executed after the specified task completes or it is determined that it will never be executed. This argument can be null if no such task is required. Note that the cleanup task will always be executed by the specified TaskExecutorService.
        Returns:
        the future representing the submitted subtask. This method never returns null assuming that the specified ExecutorService never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if either executor, cancelToken or task is null

      • executeSubTask

        public void executeSubTask(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Executes the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask synchronously on the calling thread. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the subtask to be executed throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Parameters:
        task - the task to be executed. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified task is null

      • executeSubTask

        public void executeSubTask(CancellationToken cancelToken,
                  CancelableTask task,
                  CleanupTask cleanupTask)
        Executes the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask synchronously on the calling thread. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the subtask to be executed throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which is to be checked if the submitted task is to be canceled and not be executed. This argument cannot be null.
        task - the task to be executed. This argument cannot be null.
        cleanupTask - the cleanup task to be executed after the specified task completes or it is determined that it will never be executed. This argument can be null if no such task is required. Note that the cleanup task will also be executed synchronously on the calling thread and is always executed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified task or CancellationToken is null

      • executeSubTask

        public <V> V executeSubTask(java.util.concurrent.Callable<V> task)
        Executes the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask synchronously on the calling thread. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the subtask to be executed throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the result of the subtask to be executed
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be executed. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the return value of the subtask to be executed or null if the task could not be executed because this MultiPhaseTask had already been terminated. Note that this method may also return null if the subtask returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified task is null

      • executeSubTask

        public <V> V executeSubTask(CancellationToken cancelToken,
                   CancelableFunction<V> task,
                   CleanupTask cleanupTask)
        Executes the specified task as a subtask of this MultiPhaseTask synchronously on the calling thread. The submitted task will not be actually executed if this MultiPhaseTask had been terminated before it is actually scheduled.

        If the subtask to be executed throws an exception, this MultiPhaseTask will immediately be terminated with the given exception (non-canceled and null as a result).

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the result of the subtask to be executed
        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which is to be checked if the submitted task is to be canceled and not be executed. This argument cannot be null.
        task - the task to be executed. This argument cannot be null.
        cleanupTask - the cleanup task to be executed after the specified task completes or it is determined that it will never be executed. This argument can be null if no such task is required. Note that the cleanup task will also be executed synchronously on the calling thread and is always executed.
        Returns:
        the return value of the subtask to be executed or null if the task could not be executed because this MultiPhaseTask had already been terminated. Note that this method may also return null if the subtask returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified task or CancellationToken is null

      • finishTask

        public boolean finishTask(ResultType result,
                 java.lang.Throwable exception,
                 boolean canceled)
        Invoking this method causes this MultiPhaseTask to terminate. How this task is terminated depends on the arguments of this method. Note that this MultiPhaseTask may not be able to immediately terminate because some subtask maybe running concurrently but will terminate when those concurrently running tasks actually terminate. This method guarantees that subtask submitted after this method call will never execute. Note however that even subtasks submitted before this call may be prevented from executing.
        Parameters:
        result - the result of this task. This argument can also be null if the result cannot be determined (e.g.: because the task was canceled).
        exception - the exception preventing this task to be completing normally. Specifying null usually means that the result is null as it could not be computed. However it is not required and some intermediate result can be published with the exception. In case this task completed normally, this argument can be null.
        canceled - true if this task was canceled and does not need to complete, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if this MultiPhaseTask did terminate before this method returned, false if it will terminate later

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Terminates this task with a canceled state. This method call is equivalent to calling getFuture().cancel(true) and finishTask(null, null, true.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Checks whether this MultiPhaseTask has been terminated or not. In case this task is terminated: No more previously submitted subtask will execute (not even concurrently) and submitted subtasks will not be executed as well.
        Returns:
        true if this MultiPhaseTask has been terminated, false otherwise
